CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 2 Yet , the PCE of P3HT - based PSCs is limited by its relatively large bandgap ( ∼ 1.9 eV ) with major loss of the solar radiation as well as low open circuit - voltage ( V OC ≅ 0.6 V ) due to the relatively small energy difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) of P3HT and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) of PCBM.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCE of P3HT-based PSCs |
| PCE |
| P3HT |
| PSCs |
| Bandgap of P3HT (∼ 1.9 eV) |
| Solar radiation |
| HOMO of P3HT |
| LUMO of PCBM |
| PCBM |
| Open circuit voltage ( VOC ≅ 0.6 V) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCE of P3HT-based PSCs |
| P3HT |
| PCBM |

The "PCE" in the first row is an acronym for "Power Conversion Efficiency", but it does not clearly refer to a specific material in the context of the paragraph. The "solar radiation" and "energy difference" mentioned are not materials, but rather phenomena or properties. The "highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO)" and "lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO)" are properties of materials, but in this context, they are associated with specific materials (P3HT and PCBM, respectively), so they are included as material names in the table.
